I
nvestment by the Pe(cid:415)(cid:415)oner in the 1st Respondent

T
he  1st  Respondent  was  incorporated  as  a  private  company  on  23rd  August  1994  [A6].
According to the Form 48 tendered at the (cid:415)me of incorpora(cid:415)on [A7a], the directors of the
company were the 2nd Respondent and the 3rd Respondent. The 2nd and 3rd Respondents
had  con(cid:415)nued  to  be  directors  of  the  1st  Respondent  in  1996  [A7b],  in  1997[A7c]  and
during the (cid:415)me the transac(cid:415)ons that are the subject ma(cid:425)er of this appeal were carried
out.  According  to  the  Memorandum  of  Associa(cid:415)on  of  the  1st  Respondent  [A5],  the
authorised share capital of the 1st Respondent was Rs. Ten million divided into One million
shares of Rs. Ten each, with the right to increase or reduce the share capital. A5 provided
further  that  the  2nd  and  3rd  Respondents  had  subscribed  to  one  share  each  in  the  1st
Respondent. Thus, at the (cid:415)me of incorpora(cid:415)on of the 1st Respondent, only 2 shares had
been issued. 999,998 shares in the 1st Respondent remained unallo(cid:425)ed, with the claim of
the  Pe(cid:415)(cid:415)oner  being  that  the  en(cid:415)re  999,998  shares  must  be  allo(cid:425)ed  to  him  since  he
provided the en(cid:415)rety of the capital of the 1st Respondent and was the only equity investor.
